column4: Damn.. that didn't work either. Still hangs forever at SYSLINUX.
I don't think the problem is getting an OK image on a stick. I think it's with whatever happens afterward ;-;
So.. does anybody have suggestions? My netbook seems to refuse to use any ubuntu installer made by unetbootin lili or UUI. Always hangs at SYSLINUX
I've tried formatting it as everything, exFat, FAT32, NTFS.. couldn't get anything to work.
Just install ubuntu on a new netbook. It's got windows, no cd drive, and seems to be allergix to linux.
I would recommend trying to use grub instead of syslinux.
Do you have any machine that you can boot GNU/Linux from (even from a LiveCD/USB)?
Then you can use that machine to install grub to the flash drive.
Since you're getting to thhe point that you see a message from syslinux, the problem is not a missing boot flag.
If you'd like to try grub ping me.
No.
Again, ping me if you want to try grub.
It sounds like we'll be working from another computer booted via LiveUSB. Do you have more than one USB drive?
Sadly no I don't
That's OK, that just means that if we fail the first time you'll have to re-run unetbootin (or whatever utility) to get back to a working Ubuntu environment agian.
Eh, no big deal
Is your USB drive big enough to hold both the unextracted Ubuntu .iso file and the extracted (by unetbootin) version at the same time?
OK. Create a directory called "boot-isos" on the USB drive and copy the Ubuntu iso file into that directory (as a file, do not extract it).
Then boot from the USB drive and pastebin the output of "mount" and "grub-install --version".
Where would I enter mount or grub install? I never have the option to do anything
It immediately freezes at that syslinux screen. I cannot input anything
This is all instructions for you to follow on another machine, to make a bootable USB drive using grub.
